intro: Palala fragrans, commonly known as the fragrant palala, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its aromatic leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening and traditional medicine.
